content.description:
Figure 1. Effect of light intensity (<math alttext="micromoles per square meter per second" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mtext>μmol·m</mtext><mtext>-2</mtext></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mtext>-1</mtext></msup></math>) on the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a solution containing algae
Students investigated the effect of light intensity on the rates of photosynthesis and cellular respiration in algae. They placed equal numbers of algal cells into test tubes containing a solution at <math alttext="p H 7.40" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>pH</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7.40</mn></math>. The test tubes were divided into four treatment groups, and each treatment group was exposed to a different light intensity. The <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the tubes was measured every <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and used as an indicator of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration because <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> produces an acidic solution when dissolved in water (Figure 1).
content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following was used as a control in the experiment?

choices.label: A test tube placed directly in front of a light source

The <math alttext="0 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi>μmol</mi><mtext>·</mtext><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> light-intensity treatment

The <math alttext="200 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>200</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi>μmol</mi><mtext>·</mtext><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> light-intensity treatment
A test tube containing no algal cells

content.answer: The <math alttext="0 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi>μmol</mi><mtext>·</mtext><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> light-intensity treatment

skill.text: 3.C: Identify experimental procedures that align with the question, including: i. identifying dependent and independent variables ii. identifying appropriate controls iii. justifying appropriate controls
